meanings.definition: To move unsteadily back and forth
meanings.sent1: The toddler began to teeter on the edge of the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The old chair started to teeter as the cat jumped onto it.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to teeter like a tightrope walker, but it ended up waddling comically instead.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions teetered between joy and sadness, like a seesaw in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The tower of blocks seemed to teeter on the verge of collapse.

meanings.definition: To balance or waver on the edge or brink
meanings.sent1: The decision to go to the party or stay home made her teeter on the brink of indecision.
meanings.sent2: The economy seemed to teeter on the edge of a recession.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel teetered on the edge of the branch, contemplating its next acorn heist.
meanings.sent4: His grades teetered on the brink of failure, but he managed to pull them up just in time.
meanings.sent5: The glass of water teetered dangerously close to falling off the table.
